meanings.definition: To hang on a gibbet as a form of execution.
meanings.sent1: The criminal was gibbetted for his crimes.
meanings.sent2: The pirate was gibbetted for all to see.
meanings.sent3: The town gibbetted the scarecrow to deter birds from the crops.
meanings.sent4: The old tree gibbetted the swing, swaying gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the gibbetted criminal haunted the village.

meanings.definition: To display a body on a gibbet as a warning or punishment.
meanings.sent1: The authorities gibbetted the outlaw's remains as a deterrent.
meanings.sent2: The king gibbetted the traitor's body for all to see.
meanings.sent3: The farmer gibbetted the scarecrow to keep the crows away from the cornfield.
meanings.sent4: The storm gibbetted the shipwreck on the rocks, a grim reminder of the dangers at sea.
meanings.sent5: The museum gibbetted the ancient skeleton, showcasing it for visitors to ponder.
